values:
sometimes i get words or phrases stuck in my head for days at a time for no apparent reason. last week was "we're gonna have ALL the sex", a not so famous quote from chandler.

the week before was "ampersand". i don't know why, but i liked the way it sounded. also, i kept randomly hearing one-two step. made me wanna line dance. 

anyway, this week it's "stranger danger! bad touch! bad touch!!". i don't know why, but when over used in the wrong context, this makes me laugh, like, so hard. whatev. stay tuned for next week's nonsequitor subliminal word enigma.

i leave you with this:

"last night, i dreamt of glocca morra, again... it's really a shame you can't publish a sentence. i'm convinced it would be a best seller."

- james st james, party monster
a war is waging... be prepared... oooohhhh yeeeeeah!
what does it mean when the first song you hear on the way to work and the last song you hear on the way home from work were dead or alive??? sounds ominous to me...
OH YEEEEEEEEAAAAHHH!!!! "Oh yeah? OH NO, Mr. Kool-Aid Man, oh no! You better fix that hole in my wall before my dad comes home and beats me with a toaster."

lay it all on me, please!!

i'm willing to take it all in one lump sum, provided it only gets better from here. 

but i can't keep doing this pity thing. i can't keep bracing myself when there's nothing left to brace.
OBAMA SUSHI!!! Yes. We. Did.

people walk around
with ashes on their foreheads
can't eat meat today!

40 days and nights
sacrificing things that we 
couldn't do without

spring is on the way-
then it's back to eating crap
jesus, rise again.





you guys are gonna count the syllables, huh?

hope you all had a fantastic christmas! 
 
doing ok myself over here. hope the same goes for all of you! 
i can't complain too much except for the very fact that 2009 can't come soon enough... 
on another note, we have a serious countdown for hpVI... 


can't sleep i'm so excited.

Check out this really cool pumpkin carving time waster:

http://www.cubpack81.com/images/carve_pumpkin.swf

weeee!

so it's 430 and i should be doing the rest of my homework. but my mind is going about 1000 miles an hour, which is faster than i can keep up with, so naturally, i am distracting myself from the force of thoughts. but theres been one eating away at me lately. that's making me feel even worse than i usually do... ok theres two. 

1) i am trying to practice christianity again. theres just one problem: i can't seem to locate christ. i could sure use a hand. i know he's there. or something is. just never quite when i seem to need someone the most. at any rate, i'm trying to practice what the guy preached. and i've been judging myself every step of the way. for those of you who think i don't like you or care anymore, i do. but i just can't be around people right now. i'm sorry. i hope you understand.

2) the one person i can be around has been letting me down the most. and no, i'm not talking about myself. you know who you are. i hope. 

i'm getting really tired of dreaming about the way things should go. and i'm getting tired of waiting for a change. i don't know what else to do. hiding out perhaps isn't the best thing i could be doing, but at least it's keeping me from talking to people... anyway... i guess i got what i wanted... a blessing and a burden. 

but i just wanted everyone to know that i'm constantly thinking about you all. but picking up a phone and calling sounds a lot easier than it actually is.

i have so much to be thankful for, and i am, but i can't shake this treacherous hollow... i know i'll be fine tomorrow.

but i guess i gotta say overall that life is good.

even though lately i've been getting depressed and overwhelmed as hell. i think i'm just becoming impatient in waiting for people to grow up. i think i'm one of them.

anyway, if you're reading this, that's cool. if not... well, you probably wouldn't know this entry exists, would you? 

i'm going for now. maybe i'll say hey again soon :s

there was one day when i realized and understood that you wouldn't be here with us forever. i just never managed to figure out a way to divert the pain of missing you and losing the chance to say good bye... goodbye forever nana. i love you. march 10, 1918 - august 31, 2006

yes, this is stupid. i have 2 more essays to write; one by tuesday night, the other by thursday night. i work everyday from now until tuesday, 8 hour shifts. i have class right after those shifts. no time kids, none. plus i have to finish this really boring 240 page novel to write an essay on by thursday night. but it's my fault for taking summer school :x

needless to say, if you are trying to contact me, it's gonna have to be a dire emergency, cause i am now in hiding. i'll see you all in a week or 2 when summer school is done. wish me luck!

oh well. one down, two to go...

oh, btw, lance bass is gay. wtf?!?

so the other day, we went to Happy Hollow zoo & park, which i didn't even know existed. i had fun bonding with my family. i even made a new friend! yep, me and billy kissed the monkey. she is such a ladybug. i'll call you "voldemort". ♥! lunch time! oh my jesus, i just wanted to sqeeze the crap out of them, and see if they made a squeaky noise. so cute. gorgeous. riding the turtle. it's a desert fox, and it's more vicious than it looks. awwwwwwww. timone! poke! ok, did anyone see madagascar? yeah, i swear these leemurs were just like the ones in that movie. awww... nap time! this one looks hostile, but he's actually sleeping. they sleep with their eyes open half the time. ♥! he totally stuck his tongue out at us. oh, he knew what he was doing. these big cats are so beautiful! i picked Danny the Dragon's nose! they have a love-hate relationship. that's my minnie-me. um.... what's that dragon doing in my house?!? keeping the town clean is hard work. woo-doggy! can't we just keep them in there? that thing was so hot. it burnt my ass. damsel in distress. (that's a garbage can... ewwwwwww...) and the looks on their faces are really what it's all about :) um, where'd you legs go? the monkeys. *these pictures were all taken by my uncle, Bill Vidak... check out his website: http://www.photo.net/photos/Vidak *

bite down and clench my teeth, then go crazy. it depends on who or whats around, but it gets pretty intense.

sure.

purple.

...and i won't recognize myself.

ok, so i keep realizing these things. things that are kind of important. things that should matter, and initially mold me in the long run. but i can't quite catch the grip of them. 

recently, i noticed [and accepted] the fact that i'm scatterbrained. i just never really expected it to pull me in so many directions, and bring down others alongside myself in the process.

i wish things were easier. but they aren't. and they can't be. because when people get emo, they're the only ones who exist in an entire galaxy. end of story. 

i'm sorry. slowly, i'm learning.  

but before i'm through, i'd just like to invite you to imagine the atmosphere created for me when things become flawed for you. try to dream it up next time.

you can't please them all. there's just no allegiance anymore.

i'm done.

my past five days:

friday:

- have this epiphany that i'll never get ahead, no matter how far there i feel i am
- tired from crying the past few days
- cry some more
- go to work, serve my time
- get off, go to shannon's for some drinking and a bbq
- can't quite seem to put my finger on it, but i feel very antisocial
- eventually go home, and cry myself to sleep 

saturday:

- get up early
- run some errands
- go to dad's house
- have a fun party with the family
- have a small nervous breakdown when everyone leaves
- dad corners me, step mom makes me talk by blocking the door and refusing to let me leave the house. 
- i finally talk and realize whats been killing me
- they console me and profoundly encourage me to move in with them, to help out a bit
- i am considering it
- i leave and go home around 11:30/ 12 at night
- go to sleep around 1 only to bring me to:

sunday:

- get up at 6 to be at work by 7 to do floor moves and be done by 11...
- floor moves drain my energy, plus i am already cranky from lack of sleep and tons of crying over the past week
- finish the damn moves around 2, 3 hours later than what should have been
- go home at 4
- cry a crapload more (?)
- cousin calls, depressed, wants to go walking
- i agree, i feel the same way
- we walk 4 miles
- my feet hurt

monday:
- wake up early to call the poll people
- get prepped for them
- clean the shit outta my room (if anyone wants stuff, lemme know, i'm throwin away most of it)
- go to work in the afternoon, to find that the floor move was "good"... "BUT"....
- fixed the damn floor move
- took me my entire shift 
- (lily brought me a slurpee, sunkist(: )
- go home after work, around 10 
- get to sleep around 1:30 (notice theres a pattern- i can only sleep when i don't want to)
- which brings me to:

tuesday:
- wake up at 4:30
- get showered/ dressed/ coffee
- get to polls at 6 a.m.
- sit there, bored as hell, for hours, listening to old people bitch
- so stiff, aching from walking and work
- finally get to leave at like 9-ish
- go home with a headache
- vent to a few people (sorry, and thanks if you're one of them!)
- go to sleep

wednesday:
- wake up at 7:30
- get ready
- go to my sister's school to go on a field trip with her class
- we walk to the park, where we spend the day
- i get sun-burnt, and a horrible migraine
- (this one was worth it, cause i spent it with my sister!)
- stiff and sore still, need a massage
- go meet ape right after to go tanning
- we end up going through some keepsake things, and tossing out all sorts of crap
- eventually go tanning, i am sunburnt, probably not a great idea
- go to work, do all sorts of crap
- still have a headache, though not as bad as it was
- go to a bonfire, where i freeze my ass off
- get put on the spot, and made to feel uncomfortable *thanks a lot, casanova!*
- really just wanna come home and go to sleep, but can't

now it's 1 a.m. i'm so cried out. i just want to sleep. i want a massage. no, i need both. 

goodnight!

wow... so last night i had this dream that squirrels attacked me. it was weird. me and john and gina all went to the same university in which we had a class together held outdoors in an enormous ampitheatre. the walk to the ampitheatre is very scenic and peacful, up until you get to the part where crazy ass squirrels start to attack. on the way to class one day, we are walking up the stairs in the forrest. there are at least 30 people surrounding us. we get stuck on the stairs right next to the eccentric squirrels, and we try to leave to get around to the other side where there is another entrance. the fucking squirrels start hurling grapefruit sized pine cones and whatnot at other students and passersby. john gets hit in the head by a pinecone and just runs away confused. i jump in and start trying to fight the squirrels off, but i slip in some mud and fall on my face. then, one of the little f'ers craps on me, and it all goes down the back of my shirt. then i get up, furious and ready to attack, and the bitch craps on my face. then i wake up, extremely confused, and stumble into the shower. i just don't even know. i've been having some bizarre dreams lately, but so far this one takes the cake. maybe it was a result of yesterday's ghosthunter's marathon. except there were no squirrels. TAPS rules! ♥♥♥!

ok... so in my new attempts to blog daily, here goes:

i feel like shit, i think i'm ragging, i'm  extremely irritable.


i don't even want to talk about why.  i'm sure some of you know. if not, don't ask. 

currently, i am eating ben and jerry's straight out of the pint.  i am content with life right no, for the most part, but some things just never cease to ease themselves.  blah blah blah, here is my blog.

oh crap....

so this weekend i went to JACC- i don't expect any of you who didn't attend to understand what that is.

it's a journalism conference with journalistic related workshops and competitions. so basically, i went to this one workshop on blogging. the guy said a bunch of crap about it, only it wasn't crap because i took what he said at face value.  blah blah blah, long story short, blogging is important because it get's you heard.

so i'm gonna make it a point to start blogging more and more here and there. ok thats all for now. 

bye then!

religion is a disease. it needs to be broken down. 

it is a sickness that only fellow members could understand. it is a death warrant for anyone who betrays it. it is frightening and habitual,  and people should be tested before practicing.  

please understand, i am not knocking anyone in particular. but too much of anything can be poisonous. 


<lj-cut text="more">-everything needs a balance... which means for all the good something brings, there is a bad counterpart somewhere in the world.  which, more and more often, within the politics of many churches, i find a balance within itself.

-religion was meant as a guidelines for life, not as a an entirely alternate way of living.  over a course of thousands of years, people have adjusted the rules from a human state of nature to having boundaries, and then adjusting them here and there when necessary.  sin is a human characteristic. i sin, and i am not ashamed. fuck you.

-when someone is so caught up in their religion that they disregard loved ones and make their lives miserable, then the religion probably is only there to fill the void of emptiness. yes, we know, God...or the universe.. or the great spirit.. whatever you call it...can fill the void. but you need to find it in you, and you need to embrace and accept it. sitting in a room with a bunch of other brainwashed participants isn't getting close to God, it's killing time on a sunday morning, or falling into a routine. 

- people who love their religion/ beliefs so much, i highly encourage you to talk about them, share them with me.  but for fuck's sake, DO NOT preach to me about how i need to come back to the lord, or God has decided i'm going to hell. fuck you.

there are at least 50 different grievances i have against any forced or fake practiced religion. i only mentioned these b/c recently, regretful to say, a friend of a co-worker committed suicide. while all of the late kid's friends and relatives sat around and mourned his death, reminisced, and searched inside for answers to the overall meaning of life, and how little it's valued, his mother (a hard core pentecostal) decided that it was "God's will" for him to have killed himself, and since he committed the most heinous of all sins, she would much rather dump his body off a cliff and let it rot. 

what is wrong with people? why can't we all just accept one another's beliefs and respect them? i was raised by a born again christian, who can't accept the fact that i don't agree. it's a struggle everyday of my life, because each and everytime i try to venture out of this stupid little box, a little voice in the back of my head mockingly tells me that God is judging me, and that i am gonna go to hell.

i'm not even sure if i believe in God, but i am for damn sure scared shitless that there is one, and that i will be judged and tortured. and then i often think about how depressed i was for all those years, and how i have been getting lately, and i think that there literally could be nothing worse than that overwhelming feeling, that swallows you whole, lets you soak in it's stomach acids, but doesn't digest you until you've done yourself in.  and i try to picture hell being even worse than that. but i can't. which leads me to think that i was a horrible person in some other world, and i am paying for it here and now.  or maybe this is purgatory, and God is weighing out my past life's good and bad for the time being.

all i know is that once, after literally thinking i was gonna die, all i could think was 'God/ Jesus is back... he's gonna judge me...'

why the hell should i have to live my life like that? in constant fear of pissing off the afterlife? 
i don't even know what happens there. i don't think i want to.

anyway, religion, when over-analyzed (whether positively or negatively)is a disease. it feeds on you mentally until you parish and wither away. it sucks when enjoying life becomes a chore.</lj-cut>
